message:
I have considered lots of aggregation methods. Where it is possible I use RSS, or even API. But sometimes there is no better solution than to crawl page and use magic parser :)

The best would be to integrate comments overview into Google Reader. I will try to pursue even such feature. But for now, I haven't found any solution which would provide comment aggregation service in one place from different sites. Has anyone found such?

I have been developing a web-app called Comment Reader
this is like google reader only for comments

it aggregates from most of the sites or single pages where commenting system is activated. I'm very focused on client side implementation to make it very friendly and useful to follow updates on comments.

is there a need for such application? would you use that?
this is going to be expensive to keep running because it needs to crawl a lot of pages if amount of users increases. would you pay for such app?

I'm pretty sure something similar already exists - it lets you see what your friends have commented on and subscribe to comments on posts. Something you might consider to keep your costs down - lots of blogs offer RSS feeds of their comments?
I can only imagine using it with Google Reader, not by itself.
